Reviews.Title: “Budget, Comfort, Convenience all into one”
Reviews.Author: VickyZ266
Reviews.Content: Very well localized right in the heart of Mexico City. Very comfortable, clean with excellent service and a great cafeteria. Their buffet breakfast is excellent. Across the street is the famous Alameda Central Park walk a couple of blocks to the right and you start coming across all the sights of the historic center of Mexico City such as the the Palace of Fine Arts, the Latin American Tower which you can ride up to the top and get a spectacular view of the city. Keep walking and you are the Government Palace square with the Cathedral on one end and Government Palace on another surrounded by the Jewelry district, marvelous old churches, theaters, monuments etc. Let me not forget to mention that practically on any of these corners you can hop on the city tour bus and take the great narrated 3+ hour tour all around Distrito Federal that takes you all the way to Chapultepec Park allowing you to get off and hop back on as you wish through out the day for the same reasonable fare. We have stayed at this hotel 3 times and although Mexico City does have more great luxury hotels in the surroundings, I would not have it any other way. This one has given us exactly what we need and until we find something unpleasant from them we will always go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice, straightforward hotel”
Reviews.Author: XFisher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times before (business travel) and this is my first review. I definitely recommend. It is a nice, clean, straightforward hotel. Nothing fancy. The location is very good. Within walking distance there are lots of historic places: Palacio Bellas Artes, Zocalo, Palacio Nacional, Cathedral, Templo Mayor, and the business centers of Reforma. Rooms are clean and fair sized. Be sure not to get a room facing avenida Juarez, you will have a nice view of La Alameda (park) but the noise of the traffic and people goes on past 2AM. The restaurant is fair, do not expect anything fancy. Attendants are very courteous and friendly, as well as the bellboys and the front desk persons. To the side of the hotel, across the street, there is a Hilton hotel which hosts many good restaurants in case you wish to enjoy a more formal lunch or dinner with a good wine. The hotel has free WiFi, and at least in my room the reception was very good. There are also places for those who smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: R2D2_MX
Reviews.Content: I found a discount rate for a single room for two (about 55 dollars per night) and it was great! Big room with a nice view. Excellente location if you're visiting the Historic District, Reforma or Plaza de la República. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best location in the historic center”
Reviews.Author: j_traveller2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the greatest location you've ever dreamed about, the terrace has a magnificent view of the "zocalo" and you can have a romantic dinner there. The rooms are small and some of the has no window at all, so I think it's a bit pricey for the quality of room you get. The hotel has almost nothing in amenities, however the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth night here and...no telephone !!!”
Reviews.Author: Paulistas
Reviews.Content: Imagined you had a long flight, travelling for work, and when you arrive at your room the phone is not working. You complain at the reception and they promise to fix it the next day. On the next day, imagine you worked for 12 hours, had no dinner, so everything you want is to get into your room and ask for room service. But the phone is still not working. You go down to the reception, complain, they say it is a "problem with the line" (uau !), and promise to fix it for the next day. And the situation keeps the same forever. I am in my fourth night here, and I still do not have a telephone that works !!! Yesterday they proposed to change my room. At 11 at night, after working for 13 hours, the idea of packing everything, moving to another room and unpacking again sounded like a bad-taste joke. I am sat here waiting for somebody, cannot take a shower (there will be technicians in my room, I guess), cannot order food, simply because "there is a problem with the line of your room" I've chosen this hotel based on the positive comments I was here. Now I realize most of the good comments are 4 or 5 years old. The air conditioning does not heat the room properly. There is a couch in my room which has stains. The curtains does not close properly, so I had to use a hair-clip to have it fixed. The hotel's taxis costs 160 pesos to Polanco area, while radio-taxis costs 90 pesos. Extremelly disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fine except uggh...bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: xxcharlie2007
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice location and friendly staff, but for the price I have stayed at better in Mexico City. Arrived late night fto get an early morning flight and would have been happy except that when I woke up with bed bugs. Lucky I was only staying the one night and as a very frequent traveller I had something with me for the bites. So anyway if you stay there just make sure you check your bed before you sleep, I was so tired I just turned off the light, jumped in and crashed. Other negatives were are a hard bed and fairly small room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service, quiet, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: bongoboy
Reviews.Content: Decent location in central mexico city. This hotel is located on the Alameda between the Zocalo and Reforma a few blocks from Bellas Artes. While not immediately in the heart of the Zocalo area, it is close and not overly touristy. My family and I had a great stay and returned for another night after travelling around mexico. It is locataed above a small shopping center with chain restaurants/cafes. While we look for more quaint, authentic places to eat, they were nice to have nearyby for kids who like to eat all the time. Staff is excellent and made us feel quite at home in this bustling, chaotic, exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STAY”
Reviews.Author: Happyhare06
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days while visiting my customer on July. I had no complains. The room was clean and tidy. Bed was confortable. The cleaning lady was very friendly. Mexico is so dry for someone who lives at sea level humid island like me, I needed about 3 liter of water daily. The cleaning lady was so nice of leaving me couple more free bottle water. The breakfast buffet was nice however monotone after 4 days. They barely change menu. I love the juice!! Specially grapefruit juice. Since the hotel is inside a small mall and lobby on the second floor, it is hard for someone who visit for the first time to figure out where to check in. Lack of a helping hand on the ground level took away 1 point from service. However at the lobby both Adriana and Laura was so friendly and helpful. Hotel taxi was very expensive in comparison with the "street" taxi. I spoke spanish and stayed for 2 years in Mexico so I dared to take "street" taxi, however it's not recommended for someone who visit Mexico City for the first time. Overall it is an excellent hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Cost/Benefit”
Reviews.Author: Beto_Brazil_2009
Reviews.Content: Good Location (very close to main museums and other attractions), burt the traffic there is terrible. Comfortable, average hotel, clean, good service, low rates. Good cost-benefit.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dimester
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a central location, on a major avenue with easy access to taxis (donâ€™t get the hotel ones; they are more expensive), within walking distance from the Teatro de Bellas Artes and a longer walk to el Zocalo and the Cathedral. It is close to many establishments such as pharmacies and camera stores. On the first floor of the building there is a bank, stores, and several fast food counters and coffee shops. This facilitated getting some essentials without having to leave the hotel grounds. The hotelâ€™s staff was friendly and generous. The room was clean, spacious, and everything in it worked. There is 24-hour room service. On the down side, there was no refrigerator in the room and we had to get ice from another floor. My husband found the bed hard and somewhat difficult to sleep in, but I did not find it to be so. The restaurant inside the hotel was good and moderately priced with a good and varied breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dgflyer
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large, very clean and very comfortable. The noisy downtown traffic was barely noticable. This hotel is well situated to discover the Zocolo, Zona Rosa, and Reforma areas. I booked directly with the hotel on-line received and paid about $77 plus taxes, which was at least half the cost of a hotel I had orginally booked in the Reforma area. All of downtown Mexico City, except for Reforma, looks a little rough, so the hard edges of the neighbourhood where this hotel is situated is no different than its surroundings. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: djpatruno
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location! The hotel is fairly new, the rooms are large and clean, the beds were comfortable enough, (I got a couple extra pillows), The furnishings were sparse, but functional. The staff, whose English was not the best, tried hard and were eager to please. I was able to book a couple excursions right in the hotel lobby and was picked up for the trips by the tour company. The location and setting of this hotel was a breath of fresh air on our 4 day stay. To the delight of my companion, the Fiesta Inn was located in a modern mall which contained a Starbucks, a Mc Donalds, an Italianni's Italian restaurant, as well as a half dozen other restaurants and many shops on the first two floors. You have to take the elevator in the mall to the second floor hotel lobby. There was plenty of security in and around the Hotel, and in the whole city for that matter. We felt safe in this hotel and in the surrounding area. At night we would sit out on the public benches outside the hotel, and watch the busy city passing by. It was a busy area facing Alemeda Park, just down the block from Pallace of Belles Artes. While there was plenty of shopping and banks in the immediate area, it was an interesting 10-20 minute walk to the busy downtown streets and the Zocolo. With ATM's everywhere, there is no need to bring large amounts of cash into the city. It was about a 20 minute walk to Garabaldi Square, but at night, there was a couple blocks of dimly lit areas, so I'd recommend going there with a group or in a Taxi. I loved the location of this hotel. Having stayed in the Zona Rosa area on another trip, I found this location was more centrally located, and had easier access to all the Mexico City attractions. Especially the Historic area. While this is not a luxury hotel by any means, I will book it again in a heartbeat! I would not hesitate to recommend the Fiesta Inn to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Freedomtogo
Reviews.Content: The Fiesta Inn Centro's location is perfect. A fifteen minute walk to the crowded Zocalo, it was a ring-side seat for Mexican Independence Day. It's set back from the busy Ave. Juarez and access is through a mall with shops and restaurants or a you can enter by a side street. The room was clean, fairly large and average. It had air-conditioning, which we used a few times, but the windows do not open, so the room was quiet but stifling. We had a standard hair dryer, soaps & shampoos, king bed, sofa, desk, and TV with CNN and the American Network. Although the Fiesta Inn was perfectly fine, it was standard. The pillows were thin and on their last legs, the towels were thin and rough, and the lighting in the room was set up so that when you turned the light on in the bathroom, the light in the bedroom came on. I thought the breakfast was poor and expensive, and there was some confusion with our reservations that was politely resolved, but should not have happened in the first place. It seemed like a lot of business people stayed at the Fiesta Inn, but the staff was still able to arrange a tour of Teotihuacan with a great tour guide. Also, despite some problems, the staff at the hotel are excellent, and will try anything to make your stay great. The hotel is a short distance from the metro, which we took to Chipultapec and the must-see Archealogical Museum. Don't let people dissuade you from using the Metro. It's cheap, efficient and as safe as other metros in the world. Mexico City is a great historic destination and should not be missed in your travels.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: marcovalencia
Reviews.Content: It is my first time to stay in this hotel, I really liked the decoration of rooms an also all the hotel, it is a contemporary style I think. also, all rooms and bathrooms were clean and safe. The room was located besides Av. Juarez but I barely heard the traffic! The staff were very friendly and I got all I needed, some of the rooms have internet access so it's very convenient to know that if your'e travelling with your laptop. The rates and extra charges (food and internet access) are good, not expensive, not cheap. The location is also good, near from Centro Historico and historical places. Considering all past years I've visited Mexico city, this was my best travel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fiesta Inn Centro Historico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at this hotel - which I saw rated as a 2 star hotel. I was pleasantly surprised to find the Fiesta Inn quite charming. Upon entering the lobby of the building you walk into a small shopping mall. Many types of shops: clothing, shoes, jewelry, a bank, which came in handy for converting my dollars into pesos. There was a Starbucks and several restaurants. Once you go up to the actual hotel lobby, you find pleasant hotel personnel to assist you with anything you may need. There is a small office that can book any type of sightseeing excursion you may want. They had an excellent restaurant with a great buffet and menu. Foods ranged from the tipical Mexican meals to the traditional foods. The price was right!! The hotel also had their own taxis available for your service. Security was always present in the lobby so you always felt safe. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It appeared to be a newer hotel. For me this was a 4 star hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Great experience.

HotelInfo.Name: Fiesta Inn Centro Historico
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Juarez 76 Colonia Centro, Mexico City 06010, Mexico
